title: Redesign tool call UI to be flat wall-to-wall with dark green background
description: Change the tool call UI design from the current button/card style to a flat, wall-to-wall design that stretches from edge to edge. Requirements: 1) Remove rounded corners (use square corners), 2) Use flat dark green background color, 3) Stretch full width (wall-to-wall, not constrained like a button), 4) No shadow or elevation effects, 5) Keep collapsible functionality. This will make tool calls visually distinct from chat messages while maintaining a clean, flat design aesthetic. Related: ChatView.tsx tool call rendering, Collapsible component styling.

title: Fix MCP OAuth refresh token scope mismatch error
description: When refreshing expired OAuth tokens, the token refresh fails with 400 error: 'cannot request scope `mcp.e-gineering.com/mcp:access` not provided by refresh token'. The refresh token request is including the original scope parameter, but OAuth 2.1 spec says refresh tokens should not include scope unless requesting a narrower scope. Need to investigate if we should: 1) Remove scope from refresh requests entirely, 2) Only include scope if explicitly narrowing permissions, or 3) Store the original scope from the refresh token and use that instead of the authorization scope.

title: Make tool call display full width with green background
description: Tool calls should be displayed full width instead of in constrained bubbles. Apply a subtle green background (not too bright) to visually distinguish them from regular messages. Ensure they remain collapsible. Related components: ChatView.tsx (ToolCall rendering section), may need to update Collapsible styling and Card overrides.

title: Make assistant response display full width without chat bubble
description: Currently assistant messages are displayed in chat bubbles (Card components with rounded corners and backgrounds). Change to a full-width, flat interface to better display markdown tables and other formatted content. This should improve readability for code blocks, tables, and long-form responses. Related components: ChatView.tsx (Response component), possibly need to update the message rendering logic.

title: Research conversation history sync across devices for iOS
description: Research how to sync conversation history across user's iOS devices (iPhone, iPad) for Capacitor apps. Current implementation stores conversations locally using Capacitor Preferences, which doesn't sync across devices. Need to investigate: 1) iCloud storage options for Capacitor apps (iCloud Drive, CloudKit, NSUbiquitousKeyValueStore), 2) Available Capacitor plugins for iCloud storage or sync, 3) Native iOS CloudKit APIs and how to integrate with Capacitor, 4) Best practices for syncing large conversation datasets (messages with tool calls, attachments), 5) Conflict resolution strategies when conversations are modified on multiple devices, 6) Performance implications of sync operations, 7) User privacy considerations and iCloud storage quotas, 8) Migration path from local Preferences to synced storage. The goal is to provide seamless conversation history across all user devices while maintaining performance and respecting storage limits.

title: Investigate changing color of green UI elements
description: Review and potentially change the green color used in various UI elements throughout the app. Need to investigate: 1) All locations where green colors are used (buttons, indicators, accents, etc.), 2) Current green color values (Tailwind classes like bg-green-500, text-green-600, etc.), 3) Alternative color options that maintain good contrast and accessibility, 4) Whether this affects theme consistency across light/dark modes, 5) User feedback or design rationale for color change. The goal is to evaluate if the current green color scheme works well or if an alternative would improve the overall design and user experience.

title: Research Apple Keychain integration for API key iCloud sync across devices
description: Research how to store OpenAI and Anthropic API keys in Apple Keychain with iCloud sync enabled, allowing users' API keys to automatically sync across their iOS devices. Current implementation uses capacitor-secure-storage-plugin which stores keys locally on each device. Need to investigate: 1) Best practices for Keychain iCloud sync with Capacitor apps, 2) Available Capacitor plugins that support Keychain with kSecAttrSynchronizable, 3) Native iOS methods for Keychain iCloud sync if plugin support is limited, 4) Security implications and Apple's guidelines for API key storage in synced Keychain, 5) Migration path from current secure storage to Keychain. The goal is to provide seamless API key sync across user's iPhone and iPad devices while maintaining security best practices.

title: Make assistant responses full-width without chat bubble
description: Change the assistant message design to be full-width with minimal padding instead of the current chat bubble style. Requirements: 1) Make assistant messages full-width (not constrained like user messages), 2) Add small padding on left and right sides, 3) Hide the assistant avatar icon on the left, 4) Keep the text readable and well-formatted, 5) Maintain distinction from user messages (which should keep their bubble style). This will create a cleaner, more document-like reading experience for AI responses. Related: message.tsx, ChatView.tsx assistant message rendering.

title: Ensure tool call visualization stretches wall-to-wall with no padding/margin
description: The tool call visualization in the UI should stretch completely from side to side, removing any padding or margin. Use Playwright MCP server or Chrome DevTools MCP server to open the app with a small viewport (like an iPhone) to visually confirm the fix. Iterate until there is no more whitespace around the tool calls on mobile viewports.

title: Investigate UI clipping issue: Tool calls and assistant messages have clipped edges
description: Tool calls and assistant response messages both have a small clipped/cut-off portion on the right edge or outside edges. This appears to be a CSS/layout issue where the content is extending beyond its container boundaries. Need to investigate: 1) The CSS/Tailwind classes used for tool call components, 2) The CSS/Tailwind classes used for assistant message bubbles, 3) Whether this is a padding/margin issue or an overflow issue, 4) If this affects both mobile and desktop views, 5) Potential conflicts with Card component default styling.

title: Render large JSON results with proper formatting
description: When tool calls return large JSON string results, they should be wrapped in pre-blocks or rendered with JSON syntax highlighting. Currently they may be displaying as inline text which is hard to read. Need to investigate the markdown rendering library (streamdown or react-markdown) to add custom rendering for JSON content. Consider: 1) Detect JSON strings in tool results, 2) Wrap in <pre><code> with JSON syntax highlighting, 3) May need custom markdown renderer component. Related: ChatView.tsx Response component, markdown rendering configuration.

title: Remove success pop-up after OAuth redirect on MCP server screen
description: The success pop-up that appears after an OAuth redirect on the MCP server configuration screen is no longer needed and should be removed. This pop-up currently appears when users complete OAuth authentication for MCP servers, but it provides redundant feedback that is already indicated by the server status.

title: Add support for A2A (Agent-to-Agent) functionality
description:
Research A2A (Agent-to-Agent) support in Vercel AI SDK and find a public A2A server for testing purposes.

## Research Findings (2025-12-04)

### Vercel AI SDK A2A Support
‚ùå No official support yet, but community provider available:
- **a2a-ai-provider** by DracoBlue (alpha status)
- Works with AI SDK v5+ using generateText/streamText
- GitHub tracking: Discussion #6639, Issue #7442
- Installation: pnpm install a2a-ai-provider

### A2A Protocol Overview
- Linux Foundation standard (originally Google)
- Complementary to MCP (agent-to-agent vs agent-to-tools)
- Uses agent cards at /.well-known/agent.json
- JSON-RPC 2.0 API with OAuth/API key security

### Public Testing Resources
‚úÖ Found multiple options:
1. **A2A Inspector** - Web-based testing tool (github.com/a2aproject/a2a-inspector)
2. **Google Codelabs Demo** - Burger/Pizza seller agents on Cloud Run
3. **a2a-samples** - Local demo setup (github.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples)

### Recommendations
- **Short-term**: Test with a2a-ai-provider + Google Codelabs demo agents
- **Medium-term**: Monitor official Vercel support (issue #7442)
- **Long-term**: Wait for stable release before production use

üìÑ Full research document: history/a2a-research-2025-12-04.md

title: Investigate tool call padding - ensure full width green background
description: Investigate padding around tool calls in the UI using Chrome DevTools or Playwright MCP server. The tool call expandables/collapsibles should fill the complete side-to-side width with their green background color, with no extra padding or margins creating gaps.

title: Research tool call padding using DevTools - inspect DOM structure and CSS
Fix tool call padding - remove px-4 or apply negative margin to tools
Show explicit tool names in collapsible tool UI
description: Currently tool calls show generic descriptions like 'MCP system and the server is get current' which are unclear. Change to show the full, explicit tool name like 'get current date' or the actual MCP tool name. This requires updating the tool call rendering logic to use the tool name instead of auto-generated descriptions. Related: ChatView.tsx tool rendering, investigate toolCall.toolName or similar properties.

title: Fix tool call title to display full tool name instead of truncated version
description: The tool call title in the collapsible header currently displays only the last part after underscores (e.g., 'Date' for 'MCP_server__getCurrentDate'). The extractToolName function in src/components/ai-elements/tool.tsx (lines 71-90) needs to be updated to display the full tool name after the 'tool-' prefix. This will provide better context about which tool is being called.

title: Reduce excessive whitespace around title and bottom of configured MCP server page
description: The MCP server configuration page has too much whitespace around the title and at the bottom section where configured servers are displayed. This makes the interface feel unnecessarily spaced out. Need to tighten up the spacing for a more compact, professional appearance.

title: Configure PNPM to automatically control Node.js version
description: Add configuration to package.json to specify Node.js version requirements (engines field) and configure PNPM to enforce this version requirement automatically. This ensures all developers and CI/CD environments use compatible Node.js versions (20.19+ or 22.12+ required by @vitejs/plugin-react v5).

title: Styling: Remove padding/margin from tool calls and text responses to make them wall-to-wall
description: Remove padding and margin from tool call and text response containers to achieve a wall-to-wall visual design. Currently, messages have spacing/padding that creates gaps from the container edges. The goal is to make tool calls and text responses extend fully to the edges of their containers for a more immersive, full-width appearance. Related files: ChatView.tsx (Message/MessageContent components), Response component, Tool component styling.

title: Adjust GitHub Actions triggers to exclude .beads files from initiating workflows
description: Configure GitHub Actions workflow triggers to exclude pushes that only modify files in the .beads directory. This prevents unnecessary workflow runs when only beads issue tracking files are updated. Should use path filters in workflow YAML files (paths-ignore or similar) to skip CI/CD when only .beads/** files change.
